content: Google DeepMind is introducing SIMA 2, which represents a significant advancement in the development of general and helpful embodied AI agents.
SIMA 2 integrates Gemini at its core, enabling it to move beyond basic instruction following to think, learn, and collaborate in complex, 3D environments.
SIMA 2 exhibits advanced reasoning capabilities, allowing it to achieve high-level goals in various games by describing its intentions, explaining observations, and outlining its actions.
SIMA 2 demonstrates improved generalization by transferring concepts, such as applying 'mining' from one game to 'harvesting' in another, connecting similar tasks across different contexts.

SIMA 2 possesses self-improvement capabilities, enabling it to learn new skills in unfamiliar environments through trial-and-error and Gemini-based feedback, without requiring additional human intervention.
SIMA 2 shows unprecedented adaptability when tested in simulated 3D worlds generated by the Genie 3 world model, navigating surroundings, following instructions, and progressing towards goals.
The research on SIMA 2 offers a strong pathway for applications in robotics and represents a step towards achieving Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) in the physical world.
